definitions.definition: To propel by pushing with poles, to push with a pole.
examples: Huck Finn poled that raft southward down the Mississippi because going northward against the current was too much work.

definitions.definition: To identify something quite precisely using a telescope.
examples: He poled off the serial of the Gulfstream to confirm its identity.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To furnish with poles for support.

examples: to pole hay into a barn

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To stir , as molten glass, with a pole.
( transitive , baseball ) To strike (the ball) very hard.
( transitive , metallurgy ) To treat (copper) by blowing natural gas or other reducing agent through the molten oxide, burning off the oxygen.

main_definition: To propel by pushing with poles, to push with a pole.
secondary_definitions: To identify something quite precisely using a telescope.
( transitive ) To furnish with poles for support.
( transitive ) To stir , as molten glass, with a pole.
( transitive , baseball ) To strike (the ball) very hard.
( transitive , metallurgy ) To treat (copper) by blowing natural gas or other reducing agent through the molten oxide, burning off the oxygen.

definitions.definition: To induce piezoelectricity in (a substance) by aligning the dipoles .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To induce piezoelectricity in (a substance) by aligning the dipoles .
